definition: lower form of animal life, including insects, insect larvae, worms and similar creatures/CL:條|条[tiao2],隻|只[zhi1]/(fig.) person with a particular undesirable characteristic
lit. beat the grass to scare the snake (idiom)/fig. to inadvertently alert an enemy/to punish sb as a warning to others
Tale of the White Snake/Madame White Snake
lit. tiger's head, snake's tail (idiom); fig. a strong start but weak finish
lit. draw legs on a snake (idiom); fig. to ruin the effect by adding sth superfluous/to overdo it

sentences.english: Have you ever known there are such creatures as an albino two-headed snake?
sentences.chinese: 你知道这个世界上有一种叫做双头白化蛇的生物吗？

sentences.english: Cats and snakes are traditionally cooked together (in the south only), given the name "dragon tiger fight".
sentences.chinese: 猫和蛇通常一起做，名字叫“龙虎斗”。

sentences.english: Its emblem changed from the bird to the snake, and then tot…
sentences.chinese: 巴人之族徽由鸟而蛇而虎，最终以白虎为图腾。

sentences.english: Cause, shucks, us snakes ain't got it bad.
sentences.chinese: 原因，胡说，我们没有得到蛇是它坏。

sentences.english: Snakes cast off and renew their skins.
sentences.chinese: 蛇脱了皮，又再长出皮来。

sentences.english: When we are cursing about the viciousness of the snake, we are actually pleased about its existence.
sentences.chinese: 我们在诅咒蛇的恶毒的同时却又在庆幸它的存在。

sentences.english: Be careful, there still is a snake in brushwood.
sentences.chinese: 当心，草丛中还藏着一条蛇呢。

sentences.english: Other people like fish, caged birds, tortoises and even snakes, monkeys or lions.
sentences.chinese: 另一些喜欢鱼，鸟，龟甚至蛇，猴和狮子。

sentences.english: This is the first evidence of snakes eating dinosaurs.
sentences.chinese: 这是首次发现的蛇捕食恐龙的证据。

sentences.english: When Can I Use A Somero CopperHead Laser Screed?
sentences.chinese: 当我可以使用索梅罗铜斑蛇激光整平机？

sentences.english: In time, another chamber develops -- now it looks a bit like a snake's heart.
sentences.chinese: 同时另一个腔也出现了，这样看起来就像蛇的心脏。

sentences.english: I mistook the stick for a snake.
sentences.chinese: 我把那根棒子错看成蛇了。

sentences.english: Hedgehog heard the grass move , It was snake.
sentences.chinese: 刺猬听到草嘻嘻索索的声音，蛇出现了。

sentences.english: This bird employs its beak as a weapon.
sentences.chinese: 用鸟喙啄了几下就让这条蛇一命呜呼了。

sentences.english: Some speculate that it may be a plesiosaur that survived the rest of the dinosaur population.
sentences.chinese: 一些人猜测这可能是恐龙中存活下来的蛇颈龙。

sentences.english: When he began to play a tune,we had our first glimpse of the snake.
sentences.chinese: 当他开始吹奏一支曲子时，我们才第一次看到那条蛇。

definition: lizard/common spoken equivalent of 蜥蜴[xi1 yi4]
